I cant login to Ubuntu
is is the graphical login or terminal login?
terminal logins do not show the password while you type.
is this a new install? Has the graphical login ever come up?
what happens if you sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart from the command line (you will have to enter your password again)
try "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start" without the quotes
Sudo: Command Not found.
it is case sensitive
/etc/init.d/gdm start  Command not found.
you may have installed the server version which does not come with a graphical interface.
you can install ubuntu-desktop, but that will still leave the server packages and server performance settings. If it is a new install, just re-install.
how dould i do that?
you will have to download the correct live cd and reinstall. To install the graphical part from the server type "sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop" without the quotes
can i cancel the download?
ctrl-C will cancel the current command
